title: Help ID'ing this type please!
content:
Have any idea the type being used for this catalog?

Both the sans and mono.

Much appreciated!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Screen Shot 2013-04-24 at 11.15.11 PM.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022072717/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202013-04-24%20at%2011.15.11%20PM.png) | 230.59 KB |
author: BeTheKid

comments.content: The events font is [OCR B](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022072717/http:/www.identifont.com/show?SS). The logo looks like modified Helvetica.

Agree with Renko. Looks like they started from Helvetica Neue Bold and customized /a to make a single storey /a (original /a spur looks to have been kept, better look [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022072717/http:/www.camdenartscentre.org/assets/layout/logo.png)). A better way would probably be to switch for [Helvetica Textbook Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022072717/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/helvetica/helveticatextbook-bold) to get such a single storey /a.
